Format ae_format48_3 - 48 bit(s) 0 1110
AE_SA24X2.IC1 1001110001 10
ae_fld_ls_v 3210
ae_fld_ls_su 10
s 3210

Assembler Syntax

AE_SA24X2.IC1 aed0..15(ae_ls_v), u0..3(ae_ls_su), a0..15(ars)

C Syntax

#include <xtensa/tie/xt_hifi2.h>

extern void AE_SA24X2_IC1(ae_int24x2 d, ae_valign su /*inout*/, void * a /*inout*/);

Description

AE_SA24X2.IC1 stores the low 24-bits from each half of the AE_DR register d, packed into memory, meaning that it occupies only 48-bits in memory. It forms a virtual address using the address register.

Note: the .IC1 suffix indicates that the operation is using a circular buffer addressing mode using CBEGIN1/CEND1. The updated base address is formed by adding 6 to the base address with circular wrap-around.

Implementation Pipeline

In Out
AE_CEND1 Estage, AE_CBEGIN1 Estage, ae_ls_v Mstage, ae_ls_su Mstage, ars Estage ae_ls_su Mstage, ars Estage

Protos that use AE_SA24X2.IC1

proto AE_SA24X2.IC1 { in ae_int24x2 d, inout ae_valign su, inout void * a }{}{
AE_SA24X2.IC1 d, su, a;
}
